    <x_snc_plant_mgmt_plant_diseases action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE">
        <common_name>Red rot</common_name>
        <description>Red rot is a serious disease of sugarcane that's caused by the fungus Colletotrichum falcatum (Glomerella tucumanensis). It's also known as the "cancer" of sugarcane</description>
        <family/>
        <host>fungus Glomerella tucumanensis</host>
        <number>PLD0001001</number>
        <scientific_name>Glomerella tucumanensis</scientific_name>
        <solution>Red rot disease in sugarcane can be controlled using chemical, biological, and cultural methods: 

Chemical treatments: 

Some fungicides that can be used to control red rot include: 
Amistar Top Fungicide: A broad-spectrum fungicide that can be mixed with water at a ratio of 1 ml per liter 
Carbendazim: Soak setts in a 0.1% solution for 15 minutes before planting 
Triadimefon: Soak setts in a 0.05% solution for 15 minutes before planting 
Tebusul fungicide: Mix with water at a ratio of 2.5 grams per liter 
Thiophanate methyl: A fungicide that can be used to treat setts 

Biological control: Use antagonistic microorganisms to control the disease 

Cultural methods: 

Select healthy plants from disease-free areas for planting 
Rotate the field with rice for one season and other crops for two seasons 
Grow resistant varieties like Co 86032, Co 86249, CoSi 95071, CoG 93076, CoC 22, CoSi 6, and CoG 5 
Uproot and burn infected plants, and then apply bleaching powder to the area 
Red rot is also known as the "cancer" of sugarcane. It usually spreads during the rainy season. The disease can occur when a particular variety is sown for a long time without changing, or when seeds and soil are not treated properly.</solution>
